definition:
The *Gaussian curvature* of a surface at a point $p$ is the product
$$K = \kappa_1 \kappa_2$$ of the two principal curvatures of the surface
at $p$.

The arithmetic mean of the principal curvatures at a point $p$
$$H = \frac{\kappa_1 + \kappa_2}{2}$$ is called the *mean curvature* of
the surface at $p$.
